intro: Neoporteria thiebautiana, commonly known as the Thiebaut's neoporteria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
